article.headline: Retail ETFs outperform as consumers go shopping again
article.body: Exchange-traded funds with exposure to retail companies outperformed Tuesday after a better-than-expected retail sales report and suggestions of further Washington stimulus. The SPDR S&P Retail ETF XRT, +0.05% rose 3.4% mid-morning, while the Van Eck Vectors Retail ETF RTH, +0.93% was up 2.5%, outpacing the 2.1% increase for the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87%. Nordstrom, Inc. JWN, -2.18% was the biggest gainer in the broad stock index, up 14.3%, and Kohl's Corporation KSS, -1.64% and Macy's Inc. M, -0.95% were in third and fourth place, respectively. In the year to date, however, Nordstrom shares have lost 53% of their value, while Kohl's shares are down 52%. One of the ETFs with the biggest portfolio share of both, the Deep Value ETF DVP, -0.10%, was up 4.8% Tuesday.
